text: Edwin Joseph Lisle March Philipps de Lisle, DL FSA (13 June 1852 - 5 May 1920) was a Conservative Member of Parliament for Loughborough in England from 1886 to 1892. He was the seventh son of Ambrose Lisle March Phillipps De Lisle. A Catholic, he studied at St. Mary's College, Oscott (as did his brothers Ambrose (a JP), Everard (awarded VC), Osmund, Francis, Rudolph and Gerard), where he was awarded a Good conduct medal in 1872. ==References== *The Oscottian, St Mary's College Oscott, 1888 * == External links == * Category:1852 births Category:1920 deaths Category:Alumni of St Mary's College, Oscott Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:Deputy Lieutenants of Leicestershire Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for Loughborough Category:UK MPs 1886–1892
title: Edwin de Lisle
